meanings.definition: To bring to a high degree of perfection or excellence.
meanings.sent1: She worked hard to summate her painting skills.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to summate his performance in every game.
meanings.sent3: Trying to summate her baking skills, she ended up burning the cookies.
meanings.sent4: His dedication helped him summate his knowledge like a master craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The artist's passion allowed her to summate her creativity into a masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: They needed to summate the final touches on the project.
meanings.sent2: The chef wanted to summate the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent3: In a rush to summate the report, he accidentally deleted the last page.
meanings.sent4: The tailor worked tirelessly to summate the dress for the fashion show.
meanings.sent5: The last piece of the puzzle would summate the entire picture perfectly.
